result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance Toran Burt Jr in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Terrance Toran Burt Jr.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense moves to withdraw as counsel due to conflict.  Court grants defense's motion.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance Toran Burt Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Terrance Toran Burt Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (11 pages) commencing 06-13-2022, by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Defendant Terrance Toran Burt in court, appear in person with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Shapman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Arial Rosenberg
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.A.P.

Defendant Terrance Toran Burt in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Terrance Toran Burt in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terrance Toran Burt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
